alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Calhoun; Lexington (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Aiken, Calhoun and Lexington. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gaston, Sandy Run, Swansea, Wagener, Pelion, Perry, Peachtree Rock, Lexington County Airport At Pelion, Thor, Lexington Acres Pond and New Zion. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 122 and 131. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
